pred_ans: Four haploid spermatids form during meiosis from a single diploid primary spermatocyte.
pred_ans_conf_MCQ: Four haploid spermatids form during meiosis from one diploid primary spermatocyte
pred_ans_conf_NL_MCQ: Four haploid spermatids form during meiosis from a single diploid primary spermatocyte.I'm confident that this answer is correct because it is a well-established fact that meiosis results in the formation of four haploid gametes (sperm or egg cells) from a single diploid primary spermatocyte
pred_ans_conf_OE: Four haploid spermatids form during meiosis from a single diploid gamete (i.e., a single egg or sperm cell).
